alert.note: Alert for Eddy (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 21 at 7:04PM MDT until August 24 at 3:16AM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in New Mexico... Pecos River near Artesia 6E affecting Eddy County. .Thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall over the past few days have produced abundant rainfall on the Pecos watershed upstream of Artesia. The Pecos River at Artesia is expected to rise into flood over the next couple of days, before receding through the end of the week. For the Pecos River...including Artesia 6E...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pecos River near Artesia 6E. * WHEN...From late Monday night to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, the river reaches bankfull. Overbank flooding occurs about 1/2 mile upstream from the gage and spreads onto the flood plain. As a result, river width increases to approximately 1 mile in some reaches. Minor flooding of low-lying areas occurs, but no significant damage is expected. At 12.5 feet, the river reaches minor flood stage. Structures at Wilbank Trucking, Inc., located approximately 1/4 mile east of the gage, begin to flood. At 13.5 feet, the river reaches the floor of the instrument shelter. At 15.0 feet, the river reaches moderate flood stage, flooding the approaches of U. S. Highway 82 1/2 mile east of the bridge, as well as lower structures at Wilbank Trucking, Inc. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM MDT Sunday the stage was 8.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday morning to a crest of 13.1 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 07/18/1991. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Below are the latest river stages and forecasts (feet): Fld Observed Mon Mon Tue Tue Location Stg Stg Day/Time 12am 12pm 12am 12pm Pecos River Artesia 6E 12.5 8.0 Sun 6pm 8.9 9.6 10.8 13.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 715 AM MDT.
